name: Gabriel Thornton
title: Visual Artist & Sculptor
summary: Innovative visual artist with 12 years of experience in sculpture and mixed media installations. Known for thought-provoking pieces that challenge societal norms and explore themes of identity and environmental consciousness. Seeking opportunities to showcase work in prestigious galleries and collaborate on large-scale public art projects.

education.program: Master of Fine Arts in Sculpture
Bachelor of Fine Arts in Painting

work_experience.title: Independent Artist
responsibilities: Create and exhibit original artworks in galleries across North America and Europe
Manage all aspects of art business, including marketing, sales, and client relations
Secure and complete public art commissions for cities and private corporations
Collaborate with other artists on large-scale installation projects

work_experience.title: Artist-in-Residence
work_experience.company: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
responsibilities: Developed a site-specific installation exploring the intersection of technology and nature
Conducted workshops for museum visitors on experimental art techniques
Participated in panel discussions and lectures on contemporary art practices
Guide underprivileged youth in developing artistic skills and creative expression
Organize annual art shows to showcase student works and raise funds for art supplies
Design and execute murals in urban areas to revitalize neglected spaces
Coordinate with local businesses and residents to ensure community involvement

awards.name: National Endowment for the Arts Grant
Public Art Network Year in Review
